info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 27 at 1:49PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: Arctic air will bring much colder weather through Wednesday to central Idaho. Lows Tuesday will drop into the 0 to 10 below range at lower elevations, with colder spots closer to 20 below. Below 7000 feet, wind chills will be minus 5 to minus 15. Portions of the Some locations, especially above 7000 feet will see wind chills of minus 25 to minus 35. Highs will be in the single digits to below zero in the mountains and 10 to 15 degrees above zero in the valleys. Lows will still be very cold Wednesday morning, 5 above to 5 below in the valleys and closer to minus 10 for higher elevations. With temperatures and wind chills this low, frostbite and hypothermia will set in much faster...so dress in layers and protect exposed skin. Pipes may be susceptible to freezing and bursting.
